dialog: Hi Medi, I'm concerned about Hepatitis B. How does it spread?

Hello. Hepatitis B is spread through contact with the blood, semen, or other body fluids of an infected person. It can be transmitted through sexual contact, sharing needles or syringes, or from mother to child during childbirth.
Can Hepatitis B be prevented?

Yes, there are preventive measures for Hepatitis B. Vaccination is the most effective way to prevent infection. It is recommended for all infants and children, as well as for adults at risk of exposure.
Are there any symptoms of Hepatitis B?

Some people with Hepatitis B may experience symptoms such as fatigue, abdominal pain, dark urine, and yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice). However, many people with chronic Hepatitis B do not have symptoms.

There is no cure for Hepatitis B, but there are treatments available to manage the infection and reduce the risk of complications. It is important to work with a healthcare provider to develop a treatment plan.
